Comment: This amateur starts with a basic opening.
Blackburne tries nothing esoteric, going with the Classical response.
The best second move available in this position.
The "Quiet Game" -- but not this time.
Now the sparks begin to fly.
Blackburne attacks the unprotected Knight and menaces the weak K-side with his Q.
A seemingly winning move, as the protected Knight forks Blackburne's Q and R.

Blackburne retaliates by attacking the White KR. If 6 NxR, 6...QxR ch followed by 7... QxKP ch equalizes the material and gives Blackburne the initiative. Furthermore, White's Knight at R8 would be in danger of being trapped.
White hastily moves his Rook out of danger. However, he has cut off a flight-square for his King in doing so.
Decisive. 7 Q-K2 would be answered by 7... NxQ, with a winning advantage in material. So White plays instead...
